Package don.demo.algo.cpuconcurrent

Class ParallelRunner

java.lang.Object
don.demo.algo.cpuconcurrent.ParallelRunner
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConcurrentCollector, Serializable
public class ParallelRunner extends Object implements ConcurrentCollector
Compare parallel processing performance of CPU intensive operations using both collectors and forEach in Java 8 Streams. There are two basic approaches for computing a collection of results as a batch: collector and forEach.
  • The collector approach has each thread create an immutable collection of results that are further combined into larger collections.
  • The forEach approach has each thread of parallel (multiple) execution accesses a non-shared FIFO queue data structure that is combined across multiple threads as they complete.
Parallel streams with collector and non-parallel executions require no locking, but parallel streams with forEach require locking.
Author:
Donald Trummell

      public static void main(String[] args)

      Parameters:
      args -
      • arg[0] is an integer where 0 = ListCollector, and 1 = ForEachCollector, and 3 = ForEachCollector
      • arg[1] - optional, if f or F, then use fast worker, else use slow worker
